trans-unit.source: Restore a StorSimple volume from backup | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Restore a StorSimple volume from backup | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Explains how to use the StorSimple Manager service Backup Catalog page to restore a StorSimple volume from a backup set.
trans-unit.target: Explains how to use the StorSimple Manager service Backup Catalog page to restore a StorSimple volume from a backup set.

trans-unit.source: Restore a StorSimple volume from a backup set
trans-unit.target: Restore a StorSimple volume from a backup set

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: The **Backup Catalog** page displays all the backup sets that are created when manual or automated backups are taken.
trans-unit.target: The **Backup Catalog** page displays all the backup sets that are created when manual or automated backups are taken.

trans-unit.source: You can use this page to list all the backups for a backup policy or a volume, select or delete backups, or use a backup to restore or clone a volume.
trans-unit.target: You can use this page to list all the backups for a backup policy or a volume, select or delete backups, or use a backup to restore or clone a volume.

trans-unit.source: Backup Catalog page
trans-unit.target: Backup Catalog page

trans-unit.source: This tutorial explains how to use the **Backup Catalog** page to restore your device from a backup set.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial explains how to use the **Backup Catalog** page to restore your device from a backup set.

trans-unit.source: How to use the backup catalog
trans-unit.target: How to use the backup catalog

trans-unit.source: The **Backup Catalog** page provides a query that helps you to narrow your backup set selection.
trans-unit.target: The **Backup Catalog** page provides a query that helps you to narrow your backup set selection.

trans-unit.source: You can filter the backup sets that are retrieved based on the following parameters:
trans-unit.target: You can filter the backup sets that are retrieved based on the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: **Device** – The device on which the backup set was created.
trans-unit.target: **Device** – The device on which the backup set was created.

trans-unit.source: **Backup policy** or **volume** – The backup policy or volume associated with this backup set.
trans-unit.target: **Backup policy** or **volume** – The backup policy or volume associated with this backup set.

trans-unit.source: **From** and **To** – The date and time range when the backup set was created.
trans-unit.target: **From** and **To** – The date and time range when the backup set was created.

trans-unit.source: The filtered backup sets are then tabulated based on the following attributes:
trans-unit.target: The filtered backup sets are then tabulated based on the following attributes:

trans-unit.source: **Name** – The name of the backup policy or volume associated with the backup set.
trans-unit.target: **Name** – The name of the backup policy or volume associated with the backup set.

trans-unit.source: **Size** – The actual size of the backup set.
trans-unit.target: **Size** – The actual size of the backup set.

trans-unit.source: **Created on** – The date and time when the backups were created.
trans-unit.target: **Created on** – The date and time when the backups were created.

trans-unit.source: **Type** – Backup sets can be local snapshots or cloud snapshots.
trans-unit.target: **Type** – Backup sets can be local snapshots or cloud snapshots.

trans-unit.source: A local snapshot is a backup of all your volume data stored locally on the device, whereas a cloud snapshot refers to the backup of volume data residing in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: A local snapshot is a backup of all your volume data stored locally on the device, whereas a cloud snapshot refers to the backup of volume data residing in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Local snapshots provide faster access, whereas cloud snapshots are chosen for data resiliency.
trans-unit.target: Local snapshots provide faster access, whereas cloud snapshots are chosen for data resiliency.

trans-unit.source: **Initiated by** – The backups can be initiated automatically according to a schedule or manually by a user.
trans-unit.target: **Initiated by** – The backups can be initiated automatically according to a schedule or manually by a user.

trans-unit.source: (You can use a backup policy to schedule backups.
trans-unit.target: (You can use a backup policy to schedule backups.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can use the **Take backup** option to take an interactive backup.)
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can use the **Take backup** option to take an interactive backup.)

trans-unit.source: How to restore your StorSimple volume from a backup
trans-unit.target: How to restore your StorSimple volume from a backup

trans-unit.source: You can use the **Backup Catalog** page to restore your StorSimple volume from a specific backup.
trans-unit.target: You can use the **Backup Catalog** page to restore your StorSimple volume from a specific backup.

trans-unit.source: Keep in mind, however, that restoring a volume will revert the volume to the state it was in when the backup was taken.
trans-unit.target: Keep in mind, however, that restoring a volume will revert the volume to the state it was in when the backup was taken.

trans-unit.source: Any data that was added after the backup operation will be lost.
trans-unit.target: Any data that was added after the backup operation will be lost.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.WARNING] Restoring from a backup will replace the existing volumes from the backup.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.WARNING] Restoring from a backup will replace the existing volumes from the backup.

trans-unit.source: This may cause the loss of any data that was written after the backup was taken.
trans-unit.target: This may cause the loss of any data that was written after the backup was taken.

trans-unit.source: To restore from a backup set
trans-unit.target: To restore from a backup set

trans-unit.source: On the StorSimple Manager service page, click the **Backup catalog** tab.
trans-unit.target: On the StorSimple Manager service page, click the **Backup catalog** tab.

trans-unit.source: Backup catalog
trans-unit.target: Backup catalog

trans-unit.source: Select a backup set as follows:
trans-unit.target: Select a backup set as follows:

trans-unit.source: Select the appropriate device.
trans-unit.target: Select the appropriate device.

trans-unit.source: In the drop-down list, choose the volume or backup policy for the backup that you wish to select.
trans-unit.target: In the drop-down list, choose the volume or backup policy for the backup that you wish to select.

trans-unit.source: Specify the time range.
trans-unit.target: Specify the time range.

trans-unit.source: Click the check icon
trans-unit.target: Click the check icon

trans-unit.source: check icon
trans-unit.target: check icon

trans-unit.source: to execute this query.
trans-unit.target: to execute this query.

trans-unit.source: Expand the backup set to view the associated volumes.
trans-unit.target: Expand the backup set to view the associated volumes.

trans-unit.source: These volumes must be taken offline on the host and device before you can restore them.
trans-unit.target: These volumes must be taken offline on the host and device before you can restore them.

trans-unit.source: Access the volumes on the **Volume Containers** page, and then follow the steps in [Take a volume offline](storsimple-manage-volumes.md#take-a-volume-offline) to take them offline.
trans-unit.target: Access the volumes on the **Volume Containers** page, and then follow the steps in [Take a volume offline](storsimple-manage-volumes.md#take-a-volume-offline) to take them offline.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Make sure that you have taken the volumes offline on the host first, before you take the volumes offline on the device.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Make sure that you have taken the volumes offline on the host first, before you take the volumes offline on the device.

trans-unit.source: If you do not take the volumes offline on the host, it could potentially lead to data corruption.
trans-unit.target: If you do not take the volumes offline on the host, it could potentially lead to data corruption.

trans-unit.source: Navigate back to the **Backup Catalog** tab and select a backup set.
trans-unit.target: Navigate back to the **Backup Catalog** tab and select a backup set.

trans-unit.source: Click **Restore** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **Restore** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: You will be prompted for confirmation.
trans-unit.target: You will be prompted for confirmation.

trans-unit.source: Confirmation page
trans-unit.target: Confirmation page

trans-unit.source: Review the restore information and click the check icon ![check icon](./media/storsimple-restore-from-backup-set/HCS_CheckIcon.png).
trans-unit.target: Review the restore information and click the check icon ![check icon](./media/storsimple-restore-from-backup-set/HCS_CheckIcon.png).

trans-unit.source: This will initiate a restore job that you can view by accessing the **Jobs** page.
trans-unit.target: This will initiate a restore job that you can view by accessing the **Jobs** page.

trans-unit.source: After the restore is complete, you can verify that the contents of your volumes are replaced by volumes from the backup.
trans-unit.target: After the restore is complete, you can verify that the contents of your volumes are replaced by volumes from the backup.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Learn how to [Manage StorSimple volumes](storsimple-manage-volumes.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn how to [Manage StorSimple volumes](storsimple-manage-volumes.md).
